page.title: 04FARMING: CROPWELL BUTLER
page.content: The majority of this high quality fertile land is level and well drained, and is farmed on the arable system. The crops are milling wheat, malting barley, oil seed rape & sugar beet. There are two large owner- occupied farms, based at The Grove & The Rookery. There is a livestock enterprise on the grass and parkland surrounding the house at The Grove on which fifty Limousin beef cattle are fattened. The farms employ 3 or 4 men, living within easy access. All the farms in this area use many tractors costing Â£26,000 each and some employ contractors with specialised equipment especially for sugar beet. The corn is combine harvested, every farmer having at least one harvester; the large corn growers having several. Some arable farms have drying facilities for corn crops which yield about 2 tons/acre.
